author: overpaidEngineer
content:
If there was a case study on how bad a product can be, this should be one of the fine examples. Here are my findings for future scholars. 
1. Asks for subscriptions one too many times - this is a printer and a scanner, which blocks you from using anything other than their sub-par ink to print anything and you are asked to pay them money every month
2. Why do i need an account to scan my document? There is literally no logical reason to need an account for a scan job. 
3. Scan at 300DPI when my machine supports 1200DPI. Imagine you spent $100 on a high quality camera that can shoot at 48 megapixel, but the app, the only way to take the photo, delivers the product in 12 megapixel. Gameboy camera kit had a better resolution than this joke. 
4. Constantly disconnects after a scan job. Whoever designed the firmware clearly has no business in embedded software engineering if they can‚Äôt keep a connection alive. 
5. Apple human interface guideline is ignored in every chance. You guys clearly thought you had better UX than Apple guideline, which isn‚Äôt perfect, but light years better than this UX, designed when Germans were still flying overhead
title: All you can do wrong in a product in one

author: Rotten terrifically awful
content: The process for setting up a printer so it can scan to email is RIDICULOUS. My previous HP printer model involved two steps to scan a document to a pdf that would go automatically to my email account. Now, with the new printer I have to use two devices, an app, set up an account, then follow several more steps to get the document from the app on my phone to my email account. If I don‚Äôt hear back from someone at HP explaining why this new process is necessary, let alone better, I will never ever buy an HP product EVER again and will do what I can to ensure others abide by the same. I am really unhappy with your product and it‚Äôs design.

content: this new update made my small business grind to a screeching halt today, for hours!  i had just got started printing out a batch of invoices when suddenly my printer seemed to virtually ‚Äòdisappear‚Äô and i could not figure out how to remedy the process.  the print function was disabled and said that there was not a printer available while the app said the printer was awake and all is well.  i finally figured out i had to click on the export icon then select print by app.  by the time it actually starts printing i have made a total of 5 EXTRA clicks.  and then another 4 clicks after the print job is completed before i can start the next.  this has doubled the amount of time i used to take just to print invoices.  one other feature on the newly updated app that i do not see available is the option to increase or decrease the image size.  for example i need to be able to decrease the size from 100% to 90% so that a 2 page print job will fit on 1 page.   and i need to decrease to 75% for my usps postage labels to fit nicely on my packages.  i REALLY NEED this feature and if i can figure out how to connect to the printer w my ipad without this app, i will.  so far all it is doing is pissing me off.

author: karah1999
content:
Do not opt for the HP ink subscription service as you are likely to pay an unexpected  bill, as I was. You get billed for every page you print, even if you did not order any paper, and have not had an ink order in YEARS. You pay just for the act of printing. I couldn‚Äôt believe it when I was billed ¬£20.00 for printing a few pages of my OWN paper. The customer ‚Äúservice‚Äù is effin useless, too.  Just takes you to a GPT bot and doesn‚Äôt offer the option to speak with a real person. I‚Äôm afraid this is the last straw with HP, Cancelled my membership and shan‚Äôt be returning. 

Take my advice and get the standard ink cartridges. They don‚Äôt make it obvious that this is even an option. Once you subscribe to the ink service, you have to remain on the service in order to even use the printer as the ink cartridges are connected to your account. What a joke. HP, count your m‚Äôeffin days.

author: Robert-Dowell
content:
UPDATE : I had to delete the app and reinstall as it was consuming 50% battery life when the iPad Pro was in standby.  The app has Background activity turned off, (I have it turned off by default for all apps) yet it still manages to be in the background for 8 hours a night and throughout the day.  I have not run the app in a week, and then it suddenly pops up in the battery monitor as a background task running all night and all day.  All AI options for the app are also disabled, yet it still keeps using battery life whilst doing nothing.  So I have had to delete it again. There are also the frequent crashes after scanning, this software is no longer as reliable for making PDFs as it used to be.  HP used to be known for their quality, but not so much now.

I guess I only have myself to blame for trusting them, as this is not the first time that HP have disappointed. For instance, their failure to update the HP 8600 Pro AirPrint drivers back when  iOS 11 was a thing, and yet still they still have not resolved the problem regarding the scaling of printed images.

But this review relates to HP SMART, (Smart is not a word I would use to describe this app though). Whilst scanning lots of images to my iPad Pro, I tried to make them into a PDF.  Unfortunately the software had other ideas and crashed.  When I reopened the app, predictably it no longer had any of the scans I had been working on.  Of course I was less than impressed, after losing 2 hours of work.

The app redesign leaves a lot to be desired.  Like Apple who seem to be having a war against common sense, HP seem to have decided in their Trump like wisdom that Users will know what to do, just because HP designers and engineers do.  Osmosis is not a learning tool, either make things obvious or don't change them.

Additionally, if you have quite a few images in a folder, the app just plan messes around with your files.

1) It will allow you to rename the files, sure, but if you name the image something previously within that directory, it will take the thumbnail from the previous image and overlay it on the new one.  Even if the image is no longer present in the directory.

2) Renaming images with names from old ones also increases the chance that HP Smart will decide to replace your current image with the old name one. This even seems to happen even if the old image has been deleted or is not longer in the directory.  The only work around seems to be to exit the app, kill it in multiswitcher and then reopen it.  Not an ideal solution, as it can lead to problems if you are dealing with over 150 scans in a folder.

3) If you have lots of scans in a folder, in excess of 100, the app will not remember any of the edits you've made to the images.  For instance, if you rotate the image, exit and save your changes, then quit the app and reopen it, the image will have reverted to its old orientation.  This applies to all the cropping and editing tools in the app.

4) The likelihood of Crashing the app, increases as you perform edits on images.  If you edit lots of images after you scan them, it is highly likely to crash loosing all your work.

5) The app has been redesigned, but there is a distinct lack of any hints as to how to do things.  For instance editing an image is a game of hit and miss.  I eventually found that you have to tap the image, but only after poking around and stabbing at things.

6) To top it all, if you turn off iCloud Sync, but choose to keep all the files you've scanned on your iPad, it has other ideas and deletes all files it has stored locally.  Don't even try and turn it back on as all files will be gone.  In other words, scan things and immediately extract them from the App, as HP CAN NOT be trusted to handle data.

Again not a stellar performance and not what I would have expected from HP.  The only thing this app is good for now is a gateway to scanning.  Forget the editing tools or anything else it supports, it is not currently worth the effort of wading through the bugs.

I give the App 1 star as it is able to load and scan, but as for the rest . . .
title: What's with the ZOMBIE app HP.

Wishing I‚Äôd kept the aging Epson which printed just worked, faultlessly. I‚Äôve also been told my ink levels are low and I‚Äôll be receiving supplies in the post for at least the last 3-4mths. Money well spent.. after all of this when I finally get my printout it‚Äôs illegible and I waste another 1/2hr cleaning heads or running through the alignment process. Just for that one label printout. A complete and utter failure and total waste of money. Unreliable, poorly made piece of plastic junk. Think I‚Äôll invest in a fountain pen and some quality ink.

author: batonbrat
content:
Do not buy the ink subscription! If you cancel your subscription before your ink runs out the ink cartridge, regardless of how much ink is left in it, becomes COMPLETELY useless!

This is the ONLY colour printer I have access to and I can't use it to print Christmas gifts/cards because all I have is 1 subscription cartridge and I can't afford to renew my subscription or buy non subscription ink cartridges!

If I try to print anything all is does it prints out a warning stating "This printer is not enrolled in HP Instant Ink. To continue using the installed HP Instant Ink cartridge, the printer must be enrolled."

They market the subscription as a cheaper, more convenient way to get ink but the second you can't renew your subscription you printer essentially becomes an expensive paper weight! And God forbid you use non subscription ink, because a postal strike caused your subscription ink to be severely delayed, cuz the printer throws a fit over that too!

I paid good money for this printer and now it's completely useless! 

I won't be buying HP printers or HP Ink in the future!  I'll be going with a brand that doesn't force subscriptions by rendering a product you OWN completely useless if you end up in a position where you can't give them MORE money than you've already given them! 

HP does not care about it's customers only what's in their wallets!
title: HP INK SUBSCRIPTION IS A SCAMMY CASH GRAB!

author: kusssshhh
content:
Hmm. Not sure why you needed to add so many redundant steps to the printing process, but my business isn‚Äôt happy with how long I have to ‚Äúredo‚Äù the wifi connections to print. Your software has suffered. 

My client has been staring at me now for an hour. I just downloaded a new software I‚Äôve never seen before, that automatically prints instructions on how to perform the steps THAT I JUST PERFORMED. 

If I have to get wifi instructions printed every-TIME I connect this HP, then I‚Äôm not sure if I want this brand anymore within my business. I need my equipment to do what I need it to do, when I need to do it, and we don‚Äôt need printers in our premises that suddenly change how they operate (at random intervals). I don‚Äôt feel like setting up this printer over and over (and over) in such a remedial, redundant and inefficient way. 

Your software is (now) abysmal. The fiscal and technical reasons for this direction in your company is escaping me. In my opinion this is a now a very substandard software; we are removing the rest of these printers from our premises as we speak.

Anwar Cushnie.
title: 11 out of 10 difficulty, 0.1 out of 5 for execution

author: Sven Viking
content:
Normally slow with long delays, and relatively often it freezes up entirely and needs to be restarted. Sometimes the printer itself needs to be restarted.

Requires you to reenter a pin from the bottom of the printer each and every time you want to change basic settings, but if you don‚Äôt enter the pin within a few seconds it switches to a failure screen.

If the printer is going mad printing things you don‚Äôt want, there‚Äôs no obvious way to find a print queue and cancel everything (or cancel everything on the printer itself).

Sends iOS notifications reading only ‚Äúnull‚Äù.

Gives you a one-time ultimatum where you need to choose between access to certain online features or the ability to print while your Internet is down, and apparently there‚Äôs no way to reverse this decision.

author: Kon V S
content:
Initial setup was ok. But in regular use, whatever I want to do in this app is either taking too long or is not possible at all. Everything opens as an external link in a browser - from checking printer ink levels to getting your notifications. You may as well just use the website. What‚Äôs the point of having an app?
The final straw was trying to change my shipping address for the ink. Account management opens as an in-app browser, which then asks you to log in, which then reloads the page, which then asks you to log in - a constant death loop. Seriously, this is such a fundamental feature that it should have been picked up in testing. I expected better from HP. In this day and age, apps like this are simply not good enough.

author: Jesim Ali
content:
have been using the HP Smart app for a few months now, and it has completely transformed my printing experience. The app is incredibly user-friendly, making it easy to set up and connect my printer in just a few minutes. I love the intuitive interface, which allows me to print, scan, and manage my documents seamlessly from my smartphone or tablet.

One of the standout features for me is the ability to print directly from my cloud storage accounts like Google Drive and Dropbox. This integration has saved me so much time and hassle. The scanning function is equally impressive, providing high-quality scans that I can easily save or share right from the app.

The HP Smart app also includes useful tools like the print preview and photo editing options, which have been great for getting my photos just right before printing. Additionally, the app‚Äôs Instant Ink subscription service ensures I never run out of ink, which is a huge convenience.

Overall, the HP Smart app offers a reliable and efficient solution for all my printing needs. It‚Äôs clear that a lot of thought has gone into its design and functionality, making it a must-have for anyone with an HP printer. Highly recommended!

author: Roman Mok.
content:
Die HP Smart App f√ºr iOS ist grunds√§tzlich eine solide und benutzerfreundliche Anwendung, mit der sich HP-Drucker problemlos einrichten und bedienen lassen. Die Verbindung zwischen Mobilger√§t und Drucker erfolgt in der Regel schnell und zuverl√§ssig. Besonders positiv hervorzuheben ist die einfache Bedienoberfl√§che, die es auch technisch weniger versierten Nutzern erm√∂glicht, Druck-, Scan- oder Kopiervorg√§nge ohne gr√∂√üere Schwierigkeiten durchzuf√ºhren.

Trotz dieser Vorteile weist die App jedoch einige erhebliche M√§ngel auf, die das Nutzungserlebnis deutlich beeintr√§chtigen. Insbesondere beim Scannen fehlt die M√∂glichkeit, benutzerdefinierte Einstellungen vorzunehmen. So ist es beispielsweise nicht m√∂glich, Ma√üeinheiten oder exakte Zahlenwerte f√ºr die Seitengr√∂√üe manuell einzugeben. Diese Einschr√§nkung reduziert die Flexibilit√§t erheblich ‚Äì insbesondere f√ºr Nutzer, die pr√§zise Formate oder spezielle Scanvorgaben ben√∂tigen.

Ein weiterer Kritikpunkt betrifft die Versionen der App f√ºr Windows und macOS. Hier kommt es regelm√§√üig zu Problemen mit h√§ngenden Druckauftr√§gen. Diese bleiben h√§ufig in der Warteschlange stecken, was die weitere Nutzung des Druckers blockiert. In vielen F√§llen hilft nur ein vollst√§ndiges Ausschalten und erneutes Einschalten des Druckers, um den Fehler zu beheben ‚Äì ein umst√§ndlicher und zeitraubender Vorgang, der in einer professionellen Umgebung kaum akzeptabel ist.

Zusammenfassend l√§sst sich sagen: Die HP Smart App erf√ºllt im Alltag grundlegende Aufgaben zuverl√§ssig, weist jedoch bei erweiterten Funktionen und in der Stabilit√§t der Desktop-Versionen gravierende Schw√§chen auf. Eine gezielte Weiterentwicklung insbesondere im Bereich der benutzerdefinierten Scanoptionen sowie der Druckauftragsverwaltung w√§re dringend w√ºnschenswert.

author: Wildcho
content:
It is super amazing that The color printing option does not exist! 
The app only allow me to print the picture black and white! No option to change! Even my color ink is still more than half full!
Finally I used the out of the box printing function in iPhone. Wow iPhone allow me to print in color! Not HP Smart app! What an amazing iPhone feature!

I respected and trusted HP to update the app immediately when the 7.0.1 released. Thank HP to realize that such large company‚Äôs QA is also unreliable! Thank you! I got it! Will never use the app!

author: Roger Review ES
content:
El modelo de suscripci√≥n te compromete a pagos recurrentes sin que estos cumplan su √∫nico cometido, que es el buen funcionamiento y disponibilidad de tinta para la impresora. En cambio, se aseguran de que si no es bajo sus "condiciones", la impresora quede totalmente inutilizada. Adem√°s, pretenden cobrar por hoja, no por la cantidad de tinta utilizada (la correlaci√≥n se da a su favor).

En otras palabras, es un servicio de impresi√≥n bajo demanda en el que tienes que pagar por la impresora, el mantenimiento y, adem√°s, la espera. La rentabilidad que obtienen as√≠ es enorme, asegur√°ndose pagos recurrentes (lo que les brinda un considerable cashflow) y creando barreras para la competencia, a costa del consumidor. 

No es inteligente. Lo inteligente ser√≠a encubrir la cuota mensual como un servicio de mantenimiento en l√≠nea, dar la impresora "gratis" y, ofrecer adem√°s, la cantidad de tinta necesaria.
title: Estafa

author: Froger Kroak
content:
You need to agree to various types of data collection to use the app at all. If you want it to do anything your phone can't already do without the app, like scanning, you also need to create an account, agree to those terms and conditions and be signed in for even more data collection.

A simple app that would allow customers to use their printer and scanner on the local network is all it would take. That's what people generally want when they buy a printer. Anything else should be optional.

It seems HP is in the business of collecting and exploiting your data, and the whole printer thing is just a way of getting to it.
title: Modern privacy nightmare garbage

content:

HP fouls you to do so.

Once done, you cannot ever cancel or go back! 

Printer itself works fine. Good prints and scans. Even without using the app or other HP software.

author: Barski j
content:
Op een gemaakte manier producten moeilijker maken dan nodig, verdient eigelijk geen ster. Wat jammer dat een simpel product wordt uitgemolken tot een gecompliceerd onding, waardoor het apparaat veranderd in een schaduw van wat het had moeten zijn. Ik zie een printer-scanner, ik ervaar een onnodig tijd verspillend ict project. Een app om het product te gebruiken via je telefoon en wifi prima. Een modern apparaat dat niet als ‚Äòfailsafe‚Äô bekabeling heeft is kwalijk. Samenvattend; app werkt beroerd, onnodig ingewikkeld en te veel ingesteld op de consument ‚Äòovercommited‚Äô maken aan het hp ecosysteem. De gekoppelde printer, in mijn geval de hp deskjet 2721e zal vast een prima apparaat zijn als ik het met een optionele kabel aan de computer kan koppelen en op het knopje PRINTEN of SCANNEN klik. Kan het apparaat niet. Vies. Bah. Oja tevens het verplichten van een app, en daarmee dus al mijn documenten door het bijbehorende ecosysteem te pushen waardoor je wel blind vertrouwen moet hebben in het bedrijf waar je documenten doorheen gaan, vind ik eng. Ik geloof op veiligheidsgebied niet in kwaadwilligheid van hp, maar des te minder bedrijven in en om mijn documenten, des te beter. 

HP sorry, you just missed the point on personal administrative safety and your unnecessary involvement in them.
title: Artifici√´le moeilijkheden en veiligheidszorgen

Ik raad deze manier van printen en service zeer zeker aan in mijn administratieve netwerk en bij mijn klanten!  Top product, en dat voor een zachte prijs.

author: Noemenor
content:
Ik heb een HP abonnement genomen om nooit zonder inkt te zitten. Maar ik heb in een jaar tijd nog maar een keer inkt geleverd gekregen. Verder blijf ik de melding krijgen: volgens onze gegevens heeft u nog inkt liggen. Ik heb dus geen inkt meer liggen en nu al twee keer zelf gekocht omdat ik anders mijn printer niet kon gebruiken. Via de klantenservice kom ik niet verder want die zijn alleen binnen kantoor tijden bereikbaar en met mijn drukke baan heb ik de tijd niet om dan te bellen. Via de app of de bot kom ik niet verder want mijn vraag staat er niet tussen dus stoppen ze het gesprek. En mijn klacht wordt niet doorgestuurd naar HP zelf over dat ik geen inkt meer geleverd krijg. 

Daarnaast krijg ik vaak een foutmelding zonder dat er nou duidelijk is wat er fout is gegaan in de app zelf. De app blijft dan hangen op zo‚Äôn wordt geleden / we zoeken naar de fout scherm. Waardoor ik het niet kan oplossen en mijn printer helemaal niet meer kan gebruiken. 

Het lijkt allemaal zo makkelijk, tot er iets niet werkt dan kun je gewoon weken je printer niet gebruiken. Heel erg jammer!
title: Niet tevreden

author: Wateenku
content:
The installation process is frustrating and counter intuitive.

You will wonder how this system got made. After you have tried all the options the system seems to just except defeat and gets to do what it is designed to do, printing.

The installation process needs to be redone from time to time as the application forgets the installed printer and treats it as new.

Did you think you could print a PDF from just selecting it from an e-mail? No, it needs to be imported to the application folder first, then send to the printer. What could take seconds takes 5 minutes.
title: Incomprehensible installation.
